Sunhawk tried to resist.  He knew they'd arrest him if they knew he 
was on board.  They no doubt had his wanted posters on hand.  Still, 
the training as a Maximal soilder couldn't be fought.  He had to 
respond.  From the crate in the next room he called.

Sunhawk:  EX-LUTIENENT FIRST CLASS SUNHAWK OF THE AGENDA WARS PRESENT 
SIR!

He lifted out, walked into the room with the captain, saluted, and 
extended his hand for the handcuffs.

Sunhawk:  By the way I didn't steal those files and I would NEVER 
have killed her no matter what the courts said at my trial.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> {Talos}
> Maximal Exploritory Vessel, Aragorn: Bridge
> Morning
> 
> The smoke filled his optics, blinding him, the sizzle and sparking 
panels
> flashed as his vision cleared the sounds of smaller explosions 
within his
> ship told him the crash had been a bad one. He looked around at the 
others
> strewn about in the crash. Some he knew would never rise again, 
others had
> already begun to move, to shake off the effects of the forced 
landing.
> "Everyone who isn't deactivated sound off."
> 
>     His words while commanding were spoken lightly, no need to 
shoutat them
> yet after the crash. Sitting up in his chair he reached out 
touching a comm
> button, frowning at the crackle and hiss as he opened the line to 
the
> thruster section of the frigate. Smacking the panel with his 
metallic fist
> he was rewarded by the ping of connection, "Engineering report, how 
bad's
> the damage...can we lift off again anytime soon?"
> 
>     Shaking the last few webs of energon from his memory circuits 
he got a
> good look outside the ships main window, or at least the massive 
shattered
> remains of the window. Outside the sky was clear and clouds covered 
the sky
> in fluffy patches. At least they didn't land in the middle of a 
desert,
> that's all they needed, sand in their joints, or worse, snow....he 
didn't
> mind cold weather assignments so much it's just he disliked snow 
itself and
> the cold that came with it....
> 
>     Shaking his head again he frowned, that window needed repairing 
if they
> were gonna lift off again, the blast doors that sheilded them could 
still be
> working but flying based on sensors alone was always risky. 
Touching the
> communication button again, "Engineering, status on thrusters and 
general
> ship systems."
> 
> (OOC)
> 
>     Just to beat rauq to the punch the first post for the new beast 
wars...
> :)
